greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways of placing n nonattacking queens on an n X n toroidal chessboard.
comment: The sequence has been computed up to n = 23 by Rivin, Vardi & Zimmermann, see p. 637 of their paper from 1994. Further terms were calculated by the submitter, Dec 17 1999 and Jan 11 2001.
Only terms indexed by odd numbers coprime to 3 are nonzero, therefore A007705(n) = a(2n+1) is the main entry. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 01 2019
link: M. R. Engelhardt, A group-based search for solutions of the n-queens problem, Discr. Math., 307 (2007), 2535-2551.
Kevin Pratt, Closed-Form Expressions for the n-Queens Problem and Related Problems, arXiv:1609.09585 [cs.DM], 2016.
I. Rivin, I. Vardi and P. Zimmermann, The n-queens problem, Amer. Math. Monthly, 101 (1994), 629-639.
xref: See A007705, which is the main entry for this sequence.
results.author: _Matthias Engelhardt_, Dec 17 1999
ext: Term a(31) added from A007705 by _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 25 2012
